com.hcl.domino.data

Interface Item

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IAdaptable

    public interface Item
extends IAdaptable
    Carefull attention for date/time and the new Java Stuff and JNA TimeDate
    Since:
    0.5.0
    Author:
    t.b.d

      Enum for the field flags for an Item

      void copyToDocument(Document doc, boolean overwrite)
      Copies this item to a new document, retaining the current name.

      Copies this item to a new document, with a new Item name.
      <T> T get(Class<T> valueType, T defaultValue)
      Returns the item value converted to the specified data type.

      We currently support the following value types out of the box:
      String Integer Long Double DominoDateTime LocalDate LocalTime OffsetDateTime TemporalAccessor (returned as DominoDateTime)
      Additional value types are supported by implementing and registering DocumentValueConverter as Java services.
      <T> List<T> getAsList(Class<T> valueType, List<T> defaultValue)
      Returns a list of item values converted to the specified data type.

      We currently support the following value types out of the box:
      String Integer Long Double DominoDateTime LocalDate LocalTime OffsetDateTime TemporalAccessor (returned as DominoDateTime)
      Additional value types are supported by implementing and registering DocumentValueConverter as Java services.

        getAdapter

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Gets the field name. Fields beginning "$" are, by convention, system fields
        Returns:
        the field name as a String

      • getTypeValue

        int getTypeValue()
        Gets the data type for a field, as the internal int
        Returns:
        internal int value corresponding to the data type

      • getType

        ItemDataType getType()
        Gets the data type for a field, converting it to the more readable enum
        Returns:
        enum corresponding to the internal int value for the data type, or ItemDataType.TYPE_INVALID_OR_UNKNOWN if it is unknown

      • get

        <T> T get(Class<T> valueType,
          T defaultValue)
        Returns the item value converted to the specified data type.

        We currently support the following value types out of the box:
        • String
        • Integer
        • Long
        • Double
        • DominoDateTime
        • LocalDate
        • LocalTime
        • OffsetDateTime
        • TemporalAccessor (returned as DominoDateTime)

        Additional value types are supported by implementing and registering DocumentValueConverter as Java services.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of return value
        Parameters:
        valueType - class of return value
        defaultValue - default value to be returned of object property is not set
        Returns:
        return value
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified value type is unsupported

      • getAsList

        <T> List<T> getAsList(Class<T> valueType,
                      List<T> defaultValue)
        Returns a list of item values converted to the specified data type.

        We currently support the following value types out of the box:
        • String
        • Integer
        • Long
        • Double
        • DominoDateTime
        • LocalDate
        • LocalTime
        • OffsetDateTime
        • TemporalAccessor (returned as DominoDateTime)

        Additional value types are supported by implementing and registering DocumentValueConverter as Java services.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of return value
        Parameters:
        valueType - class of return value
        defaultValue - default value to be returned of object property is not set
        Returns:
        value list
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified value type is unsupported

      • getValue

        List<Object> getValue()
        Decodes the item value(s). The data is always returned as a list even though the list may contain only one element (e.g. for ItemDataType.TYPE_TEXT.
        The following data types are currently supported:
        • ItemDataType.TYPE_TEXT - List with String object
        • ItemDataType.TYPE_TEXT_LIST - List of String objects
        • ItemDataType.TYPE_NUMBER - List with Double object
        • ItemDataType.TYPE_NUMBER_RANGE - List of Double objects
        • ItemDataType.TYPE_TIME - List with Calendar object
        • ItemDataType.TYPE_TIME_RANGE - List of Calendar objects
        • ItemDataType.TYPE_OBJECT with the subtype Attachment (e.g. $File items) - List with Attachment object
        • ItemDataType.TYPE_NOTEREF_LIST - List with one UNID
        • ItemDataType.TYPE_UNAVAILABLE - returns an empty list
        Returns:
        a List of objects representing the item value

      • copyToDocument

        void copyToDocument(Document doc,
                    boolean overwrite)
        Copies this item to a new document, retaining the current name. TODO: If overwrite is false, does it create a duplicate item or abort?
        Parameters:
        doc - target document for the new item
        overwrite - true to replace any existing item with the same name

      • copyToDocument

        void copyToDocument(Document doc,
                    String newItemName,
                    boolean overwrite)
        Copies this item to a new document, with a new Item name. TODO: If overwrite is false, does it create a duplicate item or abort?
        Parameters:
        doc - target document for the new item
        newItemName - new Item name to save as
        overwrite - true to replace any existing item with the same name

      • getSequenceNumber

        int getSequenceNumber()
        Incremental integer for the nth save this Item was last updated. Cross-reference with the $Revisions field for the date and time it was saved. Be aware that for very frequently updating documents, the integer will cycle back to 1
        Returns:
        integer corresponding to the nth time the document was saved

      • getFlags

        Set<Item.ItemFlag> getFlags()
        Gets all the field flags corresponding to the Item
        Returns:
        field flags applied, e.g. {SUMMARY,READERS}

      • isSummary

        boolean isSummary()
        Whether or not the SUMMARY field flag is applied on this Item. A document can only have a maximum 64Mb total SUMMARY field data Only SUMMARY items can be displayed in a View's column as a raw field value. Some data types, e.g. TYPE_MIME_PART, cannot be SUMMARY.
        Returns:
        true for SUMMARY Items

      • setSummary

        void setSummary(boolean b)
        Changes the summary field flag
        Parameters:
        b - new flag value

      • isNames

        boolean isNames()
        Whether or not the NAMES field flag is applied on this Item. NAMES fields are used to store Domino usernames and these fields can be checked by the server's Administration Process (adminp) to update if the username changes or the user is removed.
        Returns:
        true for NAMES Items

      • isReaders

        boolean isReaders()
        Whether or not the READERS field flag is applied on this Item. READERS fields are used to store Domino usernames and restrict read access to documents. These fields can be checked by the server's Administration Process (adminp) to update if the username changes or the user is removed.
        Returns:
        true for READERS Items

      • isReadWriters

        boolean isReadWriters()
        Whether or not the READWRITERS field flag is applied on this Item. READWRITERS fields are used to store Domino usernames and restrict saving changes to documents if the person only has Author access to the database. These fields can be checked by the server's Administration Process (adminp) to update if the username changes or the user is removed.
        Returns:
        true for READWRITERS Items

      • isProtected

        boolean isProtected()
        Whether or not the Item prevents access if the person only has Author access to the database. If so, the developer will need to call setProtected(false) before making a change, and set it back to true afterwards. Item itm = doc.getFirstItem("Foo"); if (itm.isProtected()) { itm.setProtected(false); doc.replaceItemValue("Foo", "bar"); itm.setProtected(true); }
        Returns:
        true if editor access or above is required to edit the Item

      • isEncrypted

        boolean isEncrypted()
        Whether or not the Item requires additional encryption key in addition to database-level and document-level Reader access in order to see the content.
        Returns:
        true if the Item is encrypted

      • isSigned

        boolean isSigned()
        Whether or not the Item will be signed next time the document is saved. TODO: Under what circumstances would this be true and under what circumstances would it be false? i.e. Why shouldn't a developer just ignore this?
        Returns:
        true if the Item will be signed

      • setNames

        void setNames(boolean isNames)
        Sets the NAMES field flag on this Item. NAMES fields are used to store Domino usernames and these fields can be checked by the server's Administration Process (adminp) to update if the username changes or the user is removed.
        Parameters:
        isNames - true to enable NAMES flag on the Item

      • setReaders

        void setReaders(boolean isReaders)
        Sets the READERS field flag on this Item. READERS fields are used to store Domino usernames and restrict read access to documents. These fields can be checked by the server's Administration Process (adminp) to update if the username changes or the user is removed.
        Parameters:
        isReaders - true to enable READERS flag on the Item

      • setReadWriters

        void setReadWriters(boolean isReadWriters)
        Sets the READWRITERS field flag on this Item. READWRITERS fields are used to store Domino usernames and restrict saving changes to documents if the person only has Author access to the database. These fields can be checked by the server's Administration Process (adminp) to update if the username changes or the user is removed.
        Parameters:
        isReadWriters - true to enable READWRITERS flag on the Item

      • setProtected

        void setProtected(boolean isProtected)
        Change whether or not the Item prevents access if the person only has Author access to the database. If it is already protected and the current user has only Author access, the developer will need to call setProtected(false) before making a change, and set it back to true afterwards. Item itm = doc.getFirstItem("Foo"); if (itm.isProtected()) { itm.setProtected(false); doc.replaceItemValue("Foo", "bar"); itm.setProtected(true); }
        Parameters:
        isProtected - true if editor access or above is required to edit the Item

      • setEncrypted

        void setEncrypted(boolean isEncrypted)
        Change whether or not the Item requires additional encryption key in addition to database-level and document-level Reader access in order to see the content.
        Parameters:
        isEncrypted - true if the Item is encrypted

      • setSigned

        void setSigned(boolean isSigned)
        Change whether or not the Item will be signed next time the document is saved. TODO: Under what circumstances would this be true and under what circumstances would it be false? i.e. Why shouldn't a developer just ignore this?
        Parameters:
        isSigned - true if the Item will be signed

      • getProperties

        DocumentProperties getProperties()
        Extracts the key elements available in the Notes Client Document Properties window, so they can be made available in a serializable format
        Returns:
        a DocumentProperties object representing the document's meta properties

      • getMimeEntity

        Optional<MimeEntity> getMimeEntity()
        Retrieves the item content as a MIME entity, if this is a MIME item.
        Returns:
        an Optional describing a MimeEntity for the item content, or an empty one if this is not a MIME item

      • convertRFC822TextItem

        Item convertRFC822TextItem()
        This function converts the input ItemDataType.TYPE_RFC822_TEXT item in an open document to its pre-V5 equivalent; i.e. to ItemDataType.TYPE_TEXT, ItemDataType.TYPE_TEXT_LIST, or ItemDataType.TYPE_TIME.

        For example, we convert the PostedDate ItemDataType.TYPE_RFC822_TEXT item to a ItemDataType.TYPE_TIME item.

        It does not update the Domino database; to update the database, call Document.save().
        Returns:
        this item instance (for chaining)

      • remove

        void remove()
        Remove this item from the parent document

      • getValueLength

        int getValueLength()
        Returns the value length in bytes
        Returns:
        length
